title: Honouring Premades.
body:
So apparently apart from adding to their flair chance, honouring a premade is basically worthless. 

I think this is a bit dumb tbh.
Yes you will always get people who take advantage of the system, and I can see the thought process behind it.
But it also doesn't make sense because the people you create a premade group with are going to be the people you think are fun and friendly to play with.

Im not going to duo with a complete dick! I'm going to duo with someone I've played with before and thought they were polite and fun to be with. 
But now, by duoing with them, I can't reward them for their behaviour. 

Honour should go to the person you think is most deserving.
What if your duo **WAS** the most deserving on your team?

You now either have to honour someone who was less deserving _(thus ruining the point of the honour system)_, or waste your honour on someone who receives no benefit from it at all _(thus ruining the point of the honour system)_. 
It's pointless. 

More often than not, your duo **will be** the most positive person on the team _(because thats why you choose to duo with them in the first place!)_. So now by duoing with them, you actually reduce their chances of climbing the honour tree. 

________

Yes I know, people would take advantage of that and just spam honour their friends. But if we look at it, is that even that bad?
If they actually don't deserve the honour and keep misbehaving, then no matter what honour level they are, they will be dragged down to 0 eventually, and if they do deserve honour, then why shouldn't their friend honour them? They deserve it.

People are always going to be able to take advantage of the systems, that's just the way the world is. Basically anywhere in life that there is a system, there are people taking advantage of it. Homeless people go commit crimes so they can be put in a nice safe jail cell with 3 meals a day and a warm bed to sleep in, paid by us tax payers. Murderers and rapists get off scott free because the lawyer found some loophole in the legal system. 

In theory, I could go and pay a diamond player to smurf and duo with me to carry me up the ladder. Im technically being boosted, but I'm pretty sure there is no premise to ban my account because my account itself hasn't done anything illegal, because I'm not sharing my login details.

If you really want to, you'll find a way to beat the system. 
Why disadvantage the regular players because a couple of people will beat the system?
